articles.author: Matt Simon
articles.title: The Designer Who's Trying to Transform Your City Into a Sponge - WIRED
articles.description: Kongjian Yu pioneered China’s “sponge city” concept—less concrete and more green spaces to exploit stormwater instead of fighting it. Metropolises all over the world are following suit.
articles.content: Your city isnt prepared for whats coming. The classical method for dealing with stormwater is to get it out of town as quickly as possible, with gutters and sewers and canals. But more and more, that… [+2707 chars]

articles.title: Bacterial diseases a lethal threat during the Stone Age - Phys.org
articles.description: Bacterial poisoning via food and water—but also via contact such as kisses—caused a lot of suffering during the Stone Age. Diseases that today can be treated with antibiotics were then fatal, concludes new study published in Scientific Reports.
